results.title: Vida Longa = Long Life
results.creator_credit: Vicki Banwell, Bertie Films and Channel 4
results.brief_description: Visually rich and culturally loaded, ‘Vida Longa’ is an intimate journey, a simple game, between one of the oldest and youngest Capoeira Masters in history.

results.title: Polybius
results.creator_credit: Joanne Daly, James Houston, Bold Yin and Channel 4
results.brief_description: A SEGA Mega Drive, Commodore 64, floppy disk drives and hard drives sing in unison. The unusual ensemble (controlled live via MIDI) is given a last curtain call in a nostalgic farewell to forgotten friends.

results.title: Chaps on Tour 2011 [Short version]
results.brief_description: A specially made abridged version of the amazing ‘Chaps On Tour’ film, made by Toby Segar - at the age of just 16. Toby and his six friends set out to capture an image of their lives: fun and friendship driven by their mutual love of Parkour.

results.title: The Children Came Back – Briggs and Geoffrey Gurrumul Yunupingu
results.credit_line: ℗ 2015 Warner Music Australia Pty Ltd. (Briggs / Yunupingu / McGregor / Roach)
results.title_for_label: The Children Came Back – Briggs and Geoffrey Gurrumul Yunupingu
results.description: Briggs and Geoffrey Gurrumul Yunupingu’s “The Children Came Back” was released ahead of NAIDOC week in 2015. It speaks directly to Australia’s history of oppressive policies towards First Peoples, such as the forced removal of children from their families and assimilation. It’s an adaptation of “Took the Children Away” (1990) by Archie Roach and features varied traditional instrumentation like yidaki from North East Arnhem Land, vocals from the Tiwi Islands and clap sticks.
description_for_label: Briggs and Geoffrey Gurrumul Yunupingu’s “The Children Came Back” was released ahead of NAIDOC week in 2015. It speaks directly to Australia’s history of oppressive policies towards First Peoples, such as the forced removal of children from their families and assimilation. It’s an adaptation of “Took the Children Away” (1990) by Archie Roach and features varied traditional instrumentation like yidaki from North East Arnhem Land, vocals from the Tiwi Islands and clap sticks.
results.credit_line_for_label: ℗ 2015 Warner Music Australia Pty Ltd. (Briggs / Yunupingu / McGregor / Roach)

details.label: Curatorial section
display_values: The Story of the Moving Image → Moving Australia → MA-04. Music Video

results.title: Daybill for the American release of Jedda
results.credit_line: Courtesy the National Film and Sound Archive of Australia.
results.brief_description: Jedda represented a lot of historic firsts for the Australian moving image, not just in the story it was telling but how that story was told. The first fully funded Australian narrative feature to be shot in colour in the country, it used a colour process known as the Belgian Gevacolor so it was possible to shoot on location among the Australian landscape.
results.description: Jedda represented a lot of historic firsts for the Australian moving image, not just in the story it was telling but how that story was told. The first fully funded Australian narrative feature to be shot in colour in the country, it used a colour process known as the Belgian Gevacolor so it was possible to shoot on location among the Australian landscape.
description_for_label: Jedda represented a lot of historic firsts for the Australian moving image, not just in the story it was telling but how that story was told. The first fully funded Australian narrative feature to be shot in colour in the country, it used a colour process known as the Belgian Gevacolor so it was possible to shoot on location among the Australian landscape.

results.title: Britain's First Light
results.brief_description:
‘First Light’ is a British wide organisation that uses film and media production to develop skills in young people aged up to 25.
Talented youth from a wide range of backgrounds are provided with training led by film and media industry professionals using industry standard equipment. This collection draws works from several years of this creative partnership.
results.description:

results.title: Until My Heart's, Like, Finished
results.creator_credit: Phil Shepherd, Martin Hodgson, Peter Snelling, Somerset Film and First Light
results.brief_description: On the day of your 16th birthday, your mum kicks you out of home for good. You live in a car. You sofa surf. You sleep rough. Life for these young people has been tough with many challenges. Here they tell their stories in their own words, reveal they have learnt about how to survive and make plans for putting their lives back together.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Phil Shepherd, Martin Hodgson, Peter Snelling, Somerset Film and First Light

results.title: The Race
results.creator_credit: Nikki Rose, Kinetoscope Productions and First Light
results.brief_description: Neil and David met at nursery school. There was something different about Neil but David liked him, even though he often got himself into a bad temper. Neil knew that because of his condition eventually they would part company but David vowed that they would always remain best friends.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nikki Rose, Kinetoscope Productions and First Light
